Title: Push-ups
Description: Since the advent of time humans have been pushing themselves away from the ground in an attempt to become stronger than the earth they push away from, an undeniable good first step in a home workout.
WorkoutSetps: Place both hands shoulder width apart
Line your legs up just short of shoulder width
Slowly lower body to ground keeping elbows tucked, not allowing them to flare
Hold for five seconds
Slowly raise body from ground
Repeat until failure

Title: Diamond Push-ups
Description: Meet the pushups angry little brother. The diamond pushup not only focuses your chest but your triceps as well.
WorkoutSetps: Place your hands into a dimon shape, thumbs and index fingers touching
Line your legs up just short of shoulder width
Slowly lower body to ground keeping elbows tucked, not allowing them to flare
Hold for five seconds
Slowly raise body from ground
Repeat until failure

Title: Wide-grip Push-ups
Description: When working your chest without weights, you must hit every part of the pectoral muscle, this excercise helps facilitate that.
WorkoutSetps: Place your hands wider than your shoulders
Line your legs up just short of shoulder width
Slowly lower body to ground keeping elbows tucked, not allowing them to flare
Hold for five seconds
Slowly raise body from ground
Repeat until failure

Title: Pull-up
Description: Classified as the king of body weight excercises, while we try to keep you away from needing equipment, this excercise is too crucial to skip.
WorkoutSetps: Line yourself under your bar
Place hands at shoulder with and grip the bar tightly
Raise your body using your traps
Bring chin above bar
Lower yourself slowly to the ground maintaining control
Repeat until failure

Title: Chin-up
Description: A little bit less stressful version of the pull-up, this is an alternate way to build your upper back and lats
WorkoutSetps: Line yourself under your bar
Place your hands reversed on the bar, palms facing you with a tight grip
Raise your body using your traps
Bring chin above bar
Lower yourself slowly to the ground maintaining control
Repeat until failure

Title: Chest Dips
Description: Finishing the upper body portion of this workout, we will now perform the dip. While primarily a chest excercise this also will give you boulders for shoulders. You can do this excercise between two sturdy chairs.
WorkoutSetps: Approach the center of your bar set-up
Place your hands at equal positions on the bar
Lower yourself until your elbows reach 90 degrees
Hold for three seconds
Raise your body back up using your chest
Repeat until failure

Title: Step-ups
Description: While deceptivley easy, the step-up is a demon of an excercise that you can either choose to use with dumbbells or your own bodyweight.
WorkoutSetps: Approach your bench/chair
Step your right foot onto the surface and raise yourself using your quads
Hold the position at the top for just a moment
Carefully lower yourself down (watch your knees!) and then do the same for the other leg
Repeat until failure

Title: Bulgarian Split Squat
Description: While the name is a mouthful, the excercise is not. Heavily focusing on making sure you burn enough calories to enjoy some Baklava~
WorkoutSetps: Stand infront of your bench, facing away from it
Place one of your legs on the bench
Slowly lower your leg, careful not to let your knee go past your toes
Raise yourself back up in a controlled motion
Repeat until failure
Repeat for other leg

Title: Jump Squat
Description: Often referred to as the king of excercises, this version of the squat doubles as a plyometric workout.
WorkoutSetps: Align your feet at shoulder width apart and plant your heels deep to the earth
Lower yourself down, pushing your butt out like you have to use a far away toilet
Once you are ass to grass, explode up wards and project yourself into the air
Land on the balls of your feet and lower your heels back to the earth
Repeat until failure

Title: Walking Lunge
Description: One of my least favorite excercises, but one of the most necessary, the walking lunge will take you the distance.
WorkoutSetps: Start at the end of a hallway or one end of a room
Take a sizeable step, planting your foot flat and lunging forward
Slowly hover or lightly touch your knee to the ground
Push yourself forward coming to an erect position
Repeat until you have traversed the hall/room twice

Title: Rear Lunge
Description: The less aggresive version of the walking lunge, this allows you to stay in place.
WorkoutSetps: Start off standing up straight
Take a sizeable step backwards, planting your foot flat
Slowly hover or lightly touch your knee to the ground
Push yourself forward coming to an erect position
Repeat for boths legs

Title: Single Leg Calf Raise
Description: No matter how many of these you do, you will still have baby calfs, lookin' like a young cow.
WorkoutSetps: Stand infront of your bench facing away from it
Place one leg on the bench behind you
Raise your foot on the ground to your tippy toes
Hold and flex your calf for two seconds
Repeat until failure
Do for your other leg

Title: Leg-Raise
Description: Beginning the final stretch of this workout we begin with a classic leg raise designed to make both your abs and lower back DY-NO-MITE!
WorkoutSetps: Lay flat on your back
Place both legs by eachother, like you're a stiff in a mourge
Tighten your abdominal muscles and lower back
Raise your legs to the sky and form a 90 degree angle with your body
Slowly lower your legs back to the earth
Repeat until failure

Title: Floor-Crunch
Description: Old as time itself, the floor crunch is as simple as it sounds. GET TO IT!
WorkoutSetps: Lay flat on your back
Place your legs either at a 90 degree angle in the air or planted flat
Cross your arms across your chest and keep them there
Raise your body up touching your shoulders to your knees
Slowly lower your body down
Repeat until failure

Title: Plank
Description: Wrapping up this workout with the excercise that makes time stop.
WorkoutSetps: Place your elbows on the floor at shoulder width
Bring your legs and the rest of your body into a push-up position
Hold
Hold..
HOLD...!
NOW!
Release the plank after you can no longer hold
